intro: Euphrasia tranzschelii, commonly known as the Transylvanian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
